EquidistantTest.cpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002  * \file EquidistantTest.cpp
00003  * \brief Command line utility for azimuthal equidistant and Cassini-Soldner
00004  * projections
00005  *
00006  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010) <charles@karney.com>
00007  * and licensed under the LGPL.  For more information, see
00008  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00009  *
00010  * Compile with -I../include and link with Geodesic.o AzimuthalEquidistant.o
00011  * Gnomonic.o CassiniSoldner.o
00012  *
00013  * See \ref equidistanttest for usage information.
00014  **********************************************************************/
00015 
00016 #include "GeographicLib/Geodesic.hpp"
00017 #include "GeographicLib/AzimuthalEquidistant.hpp"
00018 #include "GeographicLib/CassiniSoldner.hpp"
00019 #include "GeographicLib/Gnomonic.hpp"
00020 #include "GeographicLib/DMS.hpp"
00021 #include <iostream>
00022 #include <iomanip>
00023 #include <sstream>
00024 
00025 int usage(int retval) {
00026   ( retval ? std::cerr : std::cout ) <<
00027 "Usage: EquidistantTest -(c|z|g) lat0 lon0 [-r] [-e a r] [-h]\n\
00028 $Id: EquidistantTest.cpp 6844 2010-07-18 23:57:58Z karney $\n\
00029 \n\
00030 Perform projections based on geodesics.  Convert geodetic coordinates to\n\
00031 either azimuthal equidistant, Cassini-Soldner, or gnomonic coordinates.\n\
00032 The center of the projection (lat0, lon0) is specified by either the -c\n\
00033 option (for Cassini-Soldner), the -z option (for azimuthal equidistant),\n\
00034 or the -g option (for gnomonic).  At least one of these options must be\n\
00035 given (the last one given is used).\n\
00036 \n\
00037 By default, the WGS84 ellipsoid is used.  Specifying \"-e a r\" sets the\n\
00038 equatorial radius of the ellipsoid to \"a\" and the reciprocal flattening\n\
00039 to r.  Setting r = 0 results in a sphere.  Specify r < 0 for a prolate\n\
00040 ellipsoid.\n\
00041 \n\
00042 Geodetic coordinates are provided on standard input as a set of lines\n\
00043 containing (blank separated) latitude and longitude (degrees or DMS).\n\
00044 For each set of geodetic coordinates, the corresponding projected\n\
00045 coordinates x, y (meters) are printed on standard output together with\n\
00046 the azimuth azi (degrees) and reciprocal scale rk.  For Cassini-Soldner,\n\
00047 azi is the bearing of the easting direction and the scale in the easting\n\
00048 direction is 1 and the scale in the northing direction is 1/rk.  For\n\
00049 azimuthal equidistant and gnomonic, azi is the bearing of the radial\n\
00050 direction and the scale in the azimuthal direction is 1/rk.  For\n\
00051 azimuthal equidistant and gnomonic, the scales in the radial direction\n\
00052 are 1 and 1/rk^2, respectively.\n\
00053 \n\
00054 If -r is given the reverse transformation is performed.  x and y are\n\
00055 given on standard input and each line of the standard output gives\n\
00056 latitude, longitude, azi, and rk.\n\
00057 \n\
00058 -h prints this help.\n";
00059   return retval;
00060 }
00061 
00062 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00063   using namespace GeographicLib;
00064   typedef Math::real real;
00065   bool azimuthal = false, cassini = false, gnomonic = false, reverse = false;
00066   real lat0 = 0, lon0 = 0;
00067   real
00068     a = Constants::WGS84_a(),
00069     r = Constants::WGS84_r();
00070   for (int m = 1; m < argc; ++m) {
00071     std::string arg(argv[m]);
00072     if (arg == "-r")
00073       reverse = true;
00074     else if (arg == "-c" || arg == "-z" || arg == "-g") {
00075       cassini = arg == "-c";
00076       azimuthal = arg == "-z";
00077       gnomonic = arg == "-g";
00078       if (m + 2 >= argc) return usage(1);
00079       try {
00080         DMS::DecodeLatLon(std::string(argv[m + 1]), std::string(argv[m + 2]),
00081                           lat0, lon0);
00082       }
00083       catch (const std::exception& e) {
00084         std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of " << arg << ": "
00085                   << e.what() << "\n";
00086         return 1;
00087       }
00088       m += 2;
00089     } else if (arg == "-e") {
00090       if (m + 2 >= argc) return usage(1);
00091       try {
00092         a = DMS::Decode(std::string(argv[m + 1]));
00093         r = DMS::Decode(std::string(argv[m + 2]));
00094       }
00095       catch (const std::exception& e) {
00096         std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of -e: " << e.what() << "\n";
00097         return 1;
00098       }
00099       m += 2;
00100     } else
00101       return usage(arg != "-h");
00102   }
00103 
00104   if (!(azimuthal || cassini || gnomonic)) {
00105     std::cerr
00106       << "Must specify \"-c lat lon\" or \"-z lat lon\" or \"-g lat lon\"\n";
00107     return 1;
00108   }
00109 
00110   const Geodesic geod(a, r);
00111   const CassiniSoldner cs = cassini ?
00112     CassiniSoldner(lat0, lon0, geod) : CassiniSoldner(geod);
00113   const AzimuthalEquidistant az(geod);
00114   const Gnomonic gn(geod);
00115 
00116   std::string s;
00117   int retval = 0;
00118   std::cout << std::fixed;
00119   while (std::getline(std::cin, s)) {
00120     try {
00121       std::istringstream str(s);
00122       real lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk;
00123       std::string stra, strb;
00124       if (!(str >> stra >> strb))
00125         throw GeographicErr("Incomplete input: " + s);
00126       if (reverse) {
00127         x = DMS::Decode(stra);
00128         y = DMS::Decode(strb);
00129       } else
00130         DMS::DecodeLatLon(stra, strb, lat, lon);
00131       std::string strc;
00132       if (str >> strc)
00133         throw GeographicErr("Extraneous input: " + strc);
00134       if (reverse) {
00135         if (cassini)
00136           cs.Reverse(x, y, lat, lon, azi, rk);
00137         else if (azimuthal)
00138           az.Reverse(lat0, lon0, x, y, lat, lon, azi, rk);
00139         else
00140           gn.Reverse(lat0, lon0, x, y, lat, lon, azi, rk);
00141         std::cout << std::setprecision(15)
00142                   << lat << " " << lon << " " << azi << " "
00143                   << std::setprecision(16)
00144                   << rk << "\n";
00145       } else {
00146         if (cassini)
00147           cs.Forward(lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk);
00148         else if (azimuthal)
00149           az.Forward(lat0, lon0, lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk);
00150         else
00151           gn.Forward(lat0, lon0, lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk);
00152         std::cout << std::setprecision(10)
00153                   << x << " " << y << " "
00154                   << std::setprecision(15)
00155                   << azi << " "
00156                   << std::setprecision(16)
00157                   << rk << "\n";
00158       }
00159     }
00160     catch (const std::exception& e) {
00161       std::cout << "ERROR: " << e.what() << "\n";
00162       retval = 1;
00163     }
00164   }
00165 
00166   return retval;
00167 }
